subject: RE: about integating testing[junit]
msgSnippet: ... JUnit lets you write arbitary Java code, packaged up in little chunks called test cases. If you can use Java to load test your application, you can use
messageBody:
bhanu prakash wrote:
> hi my name Bhanu prakash i have some doughts ....if
> any body is abel to clear it i will be very thankful..
>
> 1) using junit can we test load test, system testing
> etc....
> 2) can we use junit for integrating testing

JUnit lets you write arbitary Java code, packaged up in little chunks called
test cases.

If you can use Java to load test your application, you can use JUnit to do
so.

If you can use Java to system test your application, you can use JUnit to do
so.

If you can use Java to test the integration of your application, you can use
JUnit to do so.

Etc.

For some of these things, there is additional support, either within JUnit
or in one of the various extensions to JUnit.

Robert.
